--

Lincoln-Peterson Equation:

$$ 
\hat{N} = \frac{C * M}{R}
$$
```{r}
df <- tibble(C = c(500, 1000),
             M = c(400, 50),
             R = c(200, 5),
             Day = c(100, 100),
             Size = c('Small', 'Large')
             )
```

--

.pull-left[
## Data
```{r}
df %>% select(C, M, R) %>% datatable(options = list(dom = 't'))
```
]

--

.pull-right[
## Which is correct?

$$\hat{N} = \frac{500 * 400}{200} + \frac{1000 * 50}{5} = 11,000$$
$$\hat{N} = \frac{600 * 450}{205} = 3,293$$

]
